c74object.name: ossia.remote
c74object.digest: Monitor and remote control values from ossia.parameter
c74object.description: ossia.remote allows to bind to an ossia.parameter for remote control or monitoring. It can bind to local devices, or distant ones through ossia.client.

inlet.name: Value input
inlet.digest: Value to set the bound parameter to.
inlet.description: Value to set the parameter to. Several messages can be sent also, including attribute names and values.

outlet.name: UI output
outlet.digest: Prepend set'd value the parameter was set to - feed to UI objects.
outlet.description: Value the parameter was set to, prepended with set, so it can be directly set to most UI objects. This outlet is also deferlow'd (set to low priority, so it doesn't bloat other processes.

outlet.name: Value output
outlet.digest: Value the parameter was set to.
outlet.description: Value to set the parameter to - raw format.

outlet.name: Dump outlet
outlet.description: Messages and information in reply to various messages

objarg.name: node to bind to
objarg.description: ossia.remote requires an argument defining a node name in the ossia namespace it will bind to.

method.name: address
method.description: The message address followed by a symbol sets the name of the bound node. This temporary replaces the name provided initially as an argument to the object and allows to address nodes dynamically. Without any argument, address message will set the node address back to as defined as argument to the object.

method.name: anything
method.digest: Feed values to ossia.parameter or access attributes by their names
method.description: If the first symbol equals the name of a setable attribute, the value for that attribute can be updated. Else the incoming message is interpreted as a new value for ossia.parameter. Depending on the type it might be converted to one or more floats (type float or tuple) or an int (type int).

method.name: bang
method.description: A bang at leftmost inlet outputs ossia.parameter's current value

method.name: dump
method.digest: Dump all attributes settings to rightmost outlet
method.description: The message dump outputs all attribute settings to rightmost outlet

method.name: float
method.description: A float at leftmost inlet sets and outputs the value. Depending on the type attribute, the value might get converted into a int value if the type attribute is int or into a symbol if the type attribute is symbol

method.name: int
method.description: An int at leftmost inlet sets and outputs the value. Depending on the type attribute, the value might get converted into a float value if the type attribute is float or tuple or into a symbol if the type attribute is symbol

method.name: list
method.description: A list at the leftmost inlet sets and outputs the value. If the type is float, int or symbol, only the first list member will be used to set the value, and the type of this list member might be converted to fit the specified type of the parameter

method.name: reset
method.description: The message reset sent to the leftmost inlet reset the current value to the value defined by the default attribute

method.name: send
method.digest: Send value to a particular parameter instance
method.description: When using addresses pattern in ossia.remote such as 'my_spat/source.{1..3}/gain', the send message followed by a node address and value (ie send my_spat/source.2/gain 0.5) send the value of that particular parameter instance

method.name: set
method.digest: Send value to parameter without causing output
method.description: set message followed by a value will send this value to the bound parameter without causing output at the remote's outlet

attribute.name: clip
attribute.digest: Set how values exceeding range will be clipped
attribute.description:
The clip attribute defines how values exceeding the range will be managed. Available clipmodes are:
free: when set to free (default), exceeding values will be left untouched
low: when set to low, values exceeding the lower bound will be clipped. Values exceeding the upper bound will be left untouched
high: when set to high, values exceeding the upper bound will be clipped. Values exceeding the lower bound will be left untouched
both: when set to both, values exceeding lower or upper bounds will be clipped
wrap: when set to wrap, values exceeding lower or upper bound will wrapped around the opposite bound
fold: when set to fold, values exceeding lower or upper bound will folded back within the defined range

attribute.name: default
attribute.description: The default attribute sets the value to output at the leftmost outlet on model initialization. The default value can be overridden by the default model preset

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: The description attribute allows to agive a textual description for this node. This helps documenting the parameter.

attribute.name: enable
attribute.description: The enable attribute allows to enable (default: 1) or disable a node

attribute.name: hidden
attribute.digest: Hide parameter node in remote client
attribute.description: The hidden attribute allows a remote client to hide this parameter - this can be useful e.g. for "internal" or setup parameters that we don't want to give access to.

attribute.name: max
attribute.description: The max attribute defines the maximum value of expected range of possible values. Depending on the clip attribute, this might be a recommended or mandatory range. In the case of Vecnf's and tuples, this can be a list of floats in order to set different maximum values for each Vec/tuple member.

attribute.name: min
attribute.description: The min attribute defines the minimum value of expected range of possible values. Depending on the clip attribute, this might be a recommended or mandatory range. In the case of Vecnf's and tuples, this can be a list of floats in order to set different minimum values for each Vec/tuple member.

attribute.name: mode
attribute.digest: Define access mode of parameter : GET, SET, or both (BI)
attribute.description: Defines the way the value of ossia.parameter will be accessible : when set at GET, the value can only be retrieved, when at SET, it can only be set, not retrieved, and when at BI, it can be both set and retrieved.

attribute.name: mute
attribute.description: The mute attribute allows to mute the output of ossia.remote. Note that this attribute affects the remote only. Bound parameter will still output values

attribute.name: type
attribute.description:
The type attribute defines the type of the value. Possible types are:
float (default)
int
bool
tuple
symbol
impulse

attribute.name: unit
attribute.description: The unit attribute defines the unit used by the remote to communicate with the bound parameter. Values at the remote input will get converted to the bound parameter. Values received from the bound parameter will get converted to the specified remote unit.

attribute.name: priority
attribute.description: The priority attribute allows on to order how several values of a same hierarchical level can be recalled

attribute.name: range
attribute.description: The range attribute defines the expected range of possible values. Depending on the clip attribute, this might be a recommended or mandatory range.

attribute.name: rate
attribute.digest: Determine the refresh interval at which values will be set and get
attribute.description: The rate attribute defines the interval at which values will be set and get from/to the parameter

attribute.name: repetitions
attribute.description: The repetitions attribute defines whether identical values will be repeated (on by default)

attribute.name: tags
attribute.description: The tags attribute allows to associate a variable number of tags for this node. This helps documenting the parameter.
